Job Title: Shift Manager

Location: Delhi, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Manufacturing, Production, Supply Chain

Description:
As the manager of a union workforce, the Shift Manager delegates responsibilities to shift members while ensuring accuracy and efficiency. At the end of each shift, they ensure a smooth transition of responsibilities.upholds and leads a continuous improvement mindset, maintains a safe work environment, and follows quality processes and the Compass Code of Conductprioritize meeting production schedule deadlinesproblems during the shift are resolved promptly, and non-conformance is addressed.committed to enhancing employee engagement, morale, and teamwork, promoting a positive work culture
Our organization values the contributions of individuals from diverse backgrounds passionate about making a positive impact. Our team is dedicated to working on meaningful projects that promote our mission of providing better nutrition to the world through our 'Nourishing by Nature' purpose. We believe each employee has a vital role in achieving this goal, and we prioritize all team members' personal growth and development.
Qualifications for this role include:bachelor's degree in Engineering, Food Science/Food Safety, or a related fieldat least three years of experience leading a team in a food/beverage/pharmaceutical manufacturing environmentstrong verbal and written communication skillsproficiency in Microsoft Office applicationsability to make good judgments for on-the-spot problem-solvingexperience in a Union environment leadership role is preferred
Additionally, the ideal candidate should have knowledge of:continuous improvement initiatives5 SSix Sigma
What we askOur organization values the contributions of individuals from diverse backgrounds who have a passion for making a positive impact. Our team is dedicated to working on meaningful projects that promote our mission of providing better nutrition to the world through our 'Nourishing by Nature' purpose. We believe that each employee has an important role in achieving this goal, and we prioritize the personal growth and development of all team members.
What we offerFrieslandCampina Ingredients North America, Inc. offers a competitive salary in conjunction with a comprehensive benefits package and key learning and training opportunities for your growth and development because your development is not only good for your career; our products and customers also benefit from it. The mutual exchange of knowledge between colleagues is evident on the work floor; it is, after all, the most effective way to learn. FrieslandCampina offers a platform in which you are the boss of your own career and development. We are always looking for talents that are customer-focused, take responsibility for their work, and are continuously looking for opportunities to make a change. We can’t make a better world on our own, but we can do things that matter together.
Friesland Campina Ingredients North America, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants In addition to federal law requirements, FCINA, complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities within the United States. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.
FrieslandCampina Ingredients North America, Inc. expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of FCINA’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge. ** Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA) **
Accountabilitiesmanage production activities on the floor, providing direction and communicating with key stakeholderscollaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize production schedules and targets, minimize downtime and unnecessary overtimeensure health and safety, regulatory and quality protocols are always in place; proactively enforce compliance and intervene in non-compliancedevelop the skill set of the team to perform the job effectively and efficiently; proactively provide feedbackmanage the mindset and behavior of their shift and take corrective action as requiredlead communications between all employees and be proactive with leading performance feedbackmaintain inventory and ensure documentation of batch reports, OEE, and handover reportsAs part of the site leadership team, actively participate in:process improvement projects, committees, working groups, and reportingemployment matters (interviewing, training, coaching, leave of absence, etc.)management of timecards, adjusting in compliance with CBA and company policiesmonitor equipment performance and production KPIs/Metrics, analyze trends, and implement continuous improvement initiativesenforce compliance related to Union CBA, regulatory, quality, company policies, SOPsreview and develop SOPs, training shifts and implement changesproactively assist when and where needed
Our location in Delhi, New York (with 100+ employees) focuses on producing a range of hydrolysates protein for infant & toddler nutrition, adult (performance, lifestyle, healthy aging, and medical), food, beverage, and pharmaceuticals. Our manufacturing facility operates within the Business Group Ingredients; we produce ingredients for several different domestic and international customers.
Working at FrieslandCampina Ingredients means that you contribute to a better world.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
